text:
Message 1 of 4024
Hi Robert,
Confirming I will have Christmas Eve and you will have Christmas Day this year.
Can you confirm pick up time on Christmas Day?
Regards,
Chirstine
Sent:12/23/2023 at 04:38 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/23/2023 at 06:57 PM)
Subject:Christmas Holidays
Message 2 of 4024
Yes, that is what we said. Let's try 9:00 if that works for pick-up.
Are we going to discuss settings here and expectations? Or did you do all of that? Who else has access to this? We should probably both align on what
you did, agree?
robert
Sent:12/23/2023 at 06:59 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/23/2023 at 08:10 PM)
Subject:Re: Christmas Holidays
Message 3 of 4024
You ignored my question about discussing the settings and how this is used both here and in text. And I don’t know what to expect wrt response
time. I have zero info on this all or the way you set it up. When you want to discuss we can move back to it. Till then, I’m out! Thanks!
Sent:12/23/2023 at 08:23 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/23/2023 at 09:41 PM)
Subject:Done using this
Message 4 of 4024
Please refer to Dr Brown communication guidelines and response timelines and expectations. I did not adjust any settings.
I am not going to revert to a communication method that has proven volatile for you.
If you refuse to use this service, please suggest an alternative. This was the service your lawyer suggested as well and you signed up for in September.
Sent:12/23/2023 at 09:44 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/23/2023 at 10:17 PM)
Subject:Re: Done using this

Message 5 of 4024
That’s a pretty toxic response. All I asked was the info you just provided. That seems easy. But you choose to ignore it in two places and then go to
blast. In the future it might be easier just to answear a simple question than to start making assumptions and making demands.
Any chance we can actually agree to read each other’s question and see if we can just answer it first next time? I think that was Dr Browns suggestion
today as well. Behaving the exact same way, just on another platform won’t really buy us much. Let’s make this work together!
Thanks!
Sent:12/23/2023 at 10:23 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 02:57 AM)
Subject:Re: Done using this
Message 6 of 4024
“Let’s regroup tomorrow after Dr brown meeting. Any discussion today would be premature without her input on Max”
We have put our discussion off for quite a while now. Including our running list. You pushed it till after yesterday so let me know when you want to
have it.
It won’t be f2f and we should both be in a space we can be kind and willing to show grace. We finally have something in place so hope that helps us
out.
Just let me know. Wishing you the best.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 04:41 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 07:20 AM)
Subject:Regroup as Discussed
Message 7 of 4024
Should we do 26?
Sent:12/24/2023 at 07:22 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 08:08 AM)
Subject:Re: Regroup as Discussed
Message 8 of 4024
Sounds perfectly to me. Thanks!
Sent:12/24/2023 at 08:09 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 08:11 AM)
Subject:Re: Regroup as Discussed

Message 9 of 4024
Seahawks game is Sunday. Do you want to pencil  that weekend for Adrian to start schedule? Max is gone next weekend for his trip.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 08:13 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 08:13 AM)
Subject:Re: Regroup as Discussed
Message 10 of 4024
Thanks for the thoughtful suggestion.
I really appreciate that. Let’s do it!
Sent:12/24/2023 at 08:18 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 08:18 AM)
Subject:Re: Regroup as Discussed
Message 11 of 4024
We discussed going back to four a month yesterday. And I have done more than that already but wanted to get today’s in anyway. I have it, it’s ready
to go.
But FedEx seems closed on Sunday. I’ll still send it in if they are open tomorrow, but wanted to let you know in case you had an issue so we can
resolve.
I’m not sure what else I can do. Just let me know.
Thanks!
Sent:12/24/2023 at 09:28 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 08/05/2024 at 08:49 PM)
Subject:Random UA
Attachments:IMG_0607.jpg (5 MB)
Message 12 of 4024
I guess at a minimum I could also just bring it to you so you at least have it secured so you know it’s not late and under your supervision on time???
Sent:12/24/2023 at 09:33 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 10:25 AM)
Subject:Re: Random UA
Message 13 of 4024
Don’t worry about it. Thank you
Sent:12/24/2023 at 10:26 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 10:34 AM)
Subject:Re: Random UA

Message 14 of 4024
Ok. Thanks! I will still send it in. The results will be the same. But it’s just not going to make the 24 hour deadline. Much appreciated.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 10:36 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 10:38 AM)
Subject:Re: Random UA
Message 15 of 4024
When we were snuggling warm in bed on Xmas morning, I’m pretty sure they were up bright and early. I don’t want them sitting on their hands.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 12:03 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 12:25 PM)
Subject:Is 9:00 too late?
Message 16 of 4024
9am works well. I can drop off if easier.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 12:26 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 12:28 PM)
Subject:Re: Is 9:00 too late?
Message 17 of 4024
No it’s not that. It’s just they will be sitting around on Xmas if you guys are really doing yours tonight. Isn’t that lame?
Sent:12/24/2023 at 12:30 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 12:39 PM)
Subject:Re: Is 9:00 too late?
Message 18 of 4024
Let me know what time you want.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 12:39 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 12:39 PM)
Subject:Re: Is 9:00 too late?
Message 19 of 4024
I’m asking to work with you. Should I just ask them?
tbh (and don’t take this as a knock) I’ve been so blocked out of their lives for the last month that it feels awkward now. I still don’t even know what
they think is going on. Everything is uncomfortable as the outcast and I feel kinda like a fool.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 12:43 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 01:05 PM)
Subject:Re: Is 9:00 too late?

I’m looking for some help to be a good dad.
Message 20 of 4024
I’m realizing that going the OFW route, you can appear to be having a conversation with me about kids plans and just bail on it.
I was hoping for a little courtesy but I’m still learning the ropes. I went ahead and sent a message but not sure that will get us anywhere.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 01:06 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 01:06 PM)
Subject:Re: Is 9:00 too late?
Message 21 of 4024
Ok they said 8:30. I don’t think this is supposed to require immediate responses and we should set expectations like Dr. Brown protocol. I understand
need for this but wanted to set expectations moving g forward.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 01:07 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 01:09 PM)
Subject:Re: Is 9:00 too late?
Message 22 of 4024
I don’t need the lecture on etiquette. I understand how we are supposed to use it. But we were in the middle of a back and forth to get the kids time
right. You bailed even though we agreed we needed to solve it. So I understand the difference and hope you do too. Can we please just practice the
golden rule? That seems like the best framework for us.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 01:12 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 01:13 PM)
Subject:Re: Is 9:00 too late?
Message 23 of 4024
Ok. I will drop off at 8:30am. See you tomorrow.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 01:13 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 01:14 PM)
Subject:Re: Is 9:00 too late?
Message 24 of 4024
Ok. I can also come get them, but if you drop them off can you bring my Santa Hat? Thanks
Sent:12/24/2023 at 01:16 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 01:17 PM)
Subject:Re: Is 9:00 too late?

Message 25 of 4024
Will do.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 01:17 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 01:18 PM)
Subject:Re: Is 9:00 too late?
Message 26 of 4024
So they will be here for presents in the AM. Are we doing theirs here too, or do you have other plans? Just wanted to coordinate so there are no
awkward moments.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 02:20 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 02:48 PM)
Subject:Elsa and Casey
Message 27 of 4024
I can do it at the Kirkland house.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 02:49 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 02:50 PM)
Subject:Re: Elsa and Casey
Message 28 of 4024
Ok. Mind sharing what we got them? BTW- ours will all need “From Mom and Dad” except the big one that will be from “Santa” like always. fwiw-
they will only be here in the morning. I really wish you would consider joining just for that part. It would be such a nice surprise for the boys and
show everyone we are working through this and have a milestone we can agree on and celebrate our teamwork.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 02:54 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 03:05 PM)
Subject:Re: Elsa and Casey
Message 29 of 4024
Elsa took care of Casey’s from us. I got her a small purse from Milan.
I will pass but thank you for invitation.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 03:06 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 03:07 PM)
Subject:Re: Elsa and Casey

Message 30 of 4024
Ok. I honestly feel like anything, no matter what that I suggest, that will show the kids something positive, is always a hard no. No matter what.
Do you ever have plans to show any conflict resolution and civility? I am really hoping we work back to the Alyssa model someday.
But I’m honestly concerned you have cast me as such an irredeemable villain to everyone that you can’t show anything else and save face.
I guess we should be honest if we even share goals of healing and civility or if we are always going to be hateful and demeaning to each other.
And I’m not at all looking to debate it on Xmas eve. I’m just looking for a truthful answer because if it takes time, fine. But “never” is not healthy.
Sent:12/24/2023 at 03:14 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 03:21 PM)
Subject:Re: Elsa and Casey
Message 31 of 4024
This back and forth today is causing ma a lot of anxiety as I feel pressure to respond which was not intention to moving to this platform. Let’s table
this and I’m going to focus on the rest of the evening with kids. Please respect that
Sent:12/24/2023 at 03:23 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 03:23 PM)
Subject:Re: Elsa and Casey
Message 32 of 4024
Just wanted to let you know we did good.
Some awesome stocking stuffers from Mom & Dad. A really cool robotics set (1 each) from Mom & Dad. And then their big gift from Santa as we
planned!  Really think they should enjoy their gifts this year!
Hope you are having an awesome time!
Sent:12/24/2023 at 08:13 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/24/2023 at 08:28 PM)
Subject:No Response Requested
Attachments:IMG_0622.jpg (5 MB)
Message 33 of 4024
Are you guys doing it at the house in the AM?
Sent:12/24/2023 at 11:09 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 07:03 AM)
Subject:Xmas

Message 34 of 4024
That is the plan. I’ll drive them over by 8:30
Sent:12/25/2023 at 07:04 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 07:06 AM)
Subject:Re: Xmas
Message 35 of 4024
Ok. I thought I was Xmas AM gifts. You had last night. If you are going to do it anyway, which confuses me (that’s why I brought it up yesterday- I
knew it started early) let me know if you need more time. Hard to understand what we agreed to.
Sent:12/25/2023 at 07:08 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 07:25 AM)
Subject:Re: Xmas
Message 36 of 4024
Are you doing the riddles too? Just want to understand what part of our tradition you are doing  Xmas AM as I thought I was doing it with the kids.
Looks like I’m just the encore for today so just want to plan.
Sent:12/25/2023 at 07:12 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 07:26 AM)
Subject:Re: Xmas
Message 37 of 4024
No riddles. Just one gift each.
Sent:12/25/2023 at 07:26 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 07:29 AM)
Subject:Re: Xmas
Message 38 of 4024
Thanks. You are actually doing Xmas morning after all.
Sent:12/25/2023 at 07:30 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 07:55 AM)
Subject:Re: Xmas
Message 39 of 4024
BTW- who are the gifts from. I’ve been pretty transparent, and we agreed how we would do this, in great detail for months.
Sent:12/25/2023 at 07:36 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 07:55 AM)
Subject:Re: Xmas

And I updated you every step of the way to be sure we were still on the same page. Since we swap I’ll take a stab at the odd year.
Christine:
- All of December break
- Luxury trip to Cali and Universal Studios
- Christmas Eve with Rudolph’s
- Xmas morning with never noted gifts
Robert:
- Encore Xmas morning
I’ll figure out to ask “just the right question” someday. Because I clearly noted that the kids Xmas should start much earlier. That is important to
them. I’m their Dad, I know that. So I’m glad that you could swoop in and do it for them at least. I’ll be ready for Act II.
Message 40 of 4024
Agree we are going through first year adjustment. From my perspective it’s been really difficult managing your out bursts and emotional needs. From
the texts to email you sent last night to constant communication on this forum. Expectation I’m on my a game all the time after the barrage I receive
from you is tough. I’m just not able to do that anymore
Sent:12/25/2023 at 07:59 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 07:59 AM)
Subject:Re: Xmas
Message 41 of 4024
It’s not a question of being “on your game”
This is actually just a question of your honesty. Same as the email. You are never honest. From the kids, to telling me about “us”, to your relationship
with Kevin Ortega at work, to the hidden collusion with Yurushka, to the Cali trip on the cheap, to our Xmas morning plans. It never ends I I know
that.
The platform won’t matter if you are always dishonest. They say lying is hard because you always have to remember what you said. You can make it
easier on both of us by being honest. Then there are zero messages to try and figure out the truth. Can we just start there and see how it goes?
I’m game if you just start telling the truth.
I can do it starting right now, I assure you!
Sent:12/25/2023 at 08:06 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 08:08 AM)
Subject:Re: Xmas
Message 42 of 4024
I REALLY miss you being a part of this. We are having a blast and the gifts and hunt were a hit. But it’s their parents that are never going to change.
So we should show them we can work through our adult issues and still love them enough to share events. I will do whatever it takes to stop our
acrimony now that we have a plan. I want to work with you, as a team.
Sent:12/25/2023 at 09:51 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 10:35 AM)
Subject:Alyssa Model

Message 43 of 4024
I’m not ready for that.
I respectfully ask at this time we keep the conversations to the kids and not feelings and emotions.
I am glad you are having a good time. I do t plan to interfere with your day.
Sent:12/25/2023 at 10:36 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 10:37 AM)
Subject:Re: Alyssa Model
Message 44 of 4024
Can you confirm pick up time? I assumed after dinner but let me know.
Sent:12/25/2023 at 11:11 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 11:12 AM)
Subject:Pick up
Message 45 of 4024
Can AD spend the night if he chooses? We have the San Fran vs Titans game on tonight.
Sent:12/25/2023 at 11:13 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 11:13 AM)
Subject:Re: Pick up
Message 46 of 4024
Ok that is fine just let me know. I’ll pick up in the am.
Sent:12/25/2023 at 11:14 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 11:15 AM)
Subject:Re: Pick up
Message 47 of 4024
I did not want to fight with you. But it’s clear that time and space is the only correct and safe option now. I will respect that. Know that I sincerely
want to stop this now that we have a framework. In my mind that was our entire problem.
And to be clear I am apologizing for the animosity over you doing Xmas morning when I understood the plan to be different. I wrote an email that
should have been left in drafts instead of hitting send. For that I do want to apologize.
We will get better about this and afford each other the opportunity to change plans on the fly. If you care to be civil, I’ll be here. Otherwise I am going
to lay back and hope time and therapy will heal some of our wounds.I wish you the best.
Sent:12/25/2023 at 11:15 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 11:16 AM)
Subject:Re: Alyssa Model

Message 48 of 4024
So honestly, I think Max will stick around through lunch. But may want to go home after. His big Santa gift needs to be hooked up to his computer.
I’ll keep you in the loop. Thanks for being so flexible today.
I really appreciate the partnership,Christine.
Sent:12/25/2023 at 11:17 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 11:27 AM)
Subject:Re: Pick up
Message 49 of 4024
Ok. Have him text me and if I’m on a hike or out and about I’ll ask him to Uber.
I don’t plan to be on this app all day so assume future communications will just be emergencies.
My perspective is you are using it to reach out more than normal then add a question where you will say you needed a response.
Sent:12/25/2023 at 11:29 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 11:41 AM)
Subject:Re: Pick up
Message 50 of 4024
We agree. I think we need to dial it WAY back.
Hopefully it was just because there was so much planning and details we did not think about. I think it will behoove us to really be sure we include as
much needed info in the first back and forth, rather than a death by a 1k cuts, fine tuning later.
We have the right tool, let’s learn how to use it right and use it to our mutual advantage. I’m also learning more about things like the “tone meter” and
scheduling. I’ll share in one go instead of piecemeal as I was tempted to do initially.
If there is an emergency I’ll text you. Otherwise I don’t plan to be pinging you here during my time. Thanks!
Sent:12/25/2023 at 11:47 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/25/2023 at 11:47 AM)
Subject:Re: Pick up
Message 51 of 4024
I’m heading to barre this am. Was thinking pick up at 10am. Lmk if that’s an issue.
Sent:12/26/2023 at 08:15 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/26/2023 at 09:59 AM)
Subject:Re: Pick up

Message 52 of 4024
Let me know what time. Perhaps we can discuss the plan
Sent:12/26/2023 at 10:00 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/26/2023 at 10:00 AM)
Subject:Re: Regroup as Discussed
Message 53 of 4024
I am downstairs for pick up. You are refusing to bring him down stating I was off this platform for. 21 hours. Very confrontational. I am moving off
text to document.
You are suggesting to bring him back to the Kirkland home with no time stated and that you need packages that I do not see. You saw my message and
chose not to respond.
Dr. Brown suggested no pick ups and drop off at residences. You are located in an apartment tower so there is not a threat of me entering your
residence. You are stating you will come directly to the house which I do not agree to.
I will move this to lawyers as this is not working and you are not following Dr. Brown guidelines
Sent:12/26/2023 at 10:10 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/26/2023 at 10:15 AM)
Subject:Re: Pick up
Message 54 of 4024
I will not replying to this point by point. When I do, it seems to always make the matter worse. We have different perspectives and I do not wish to
inflame either our relationship or this situation. And I certainly don’t want a repeat of what just transpired.
We had a plan. It worked yesterday and came off the rails during pick up. We honestly don’t need to argue or expose the children to adult situations.
Maybe thats where we start? But I think it’s about getting back to the way we worked together yesterday.
We will chat later before 1:00 as agreed. So let me know when. My humble suggestion is that you let me know what you want and expect to make this
a healthy relationship for the kids. And even us. We need tools in our box more than ever before.
I promise to bring a healthy, optimistic, can do attitude to our discussion. I also assure you that nothing that happened in the past will be used as
material- no retribution. I only want to sincerely and calmly discuss moving forward. Golden Rule!
Thanks for the opportunity to be healthy for the kids and hopefully even us!
Sent:12/26/2023 at 10:30 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/26/2023 at 10:39 AM)
Subject:Re: Pick up

Message 55 of 4024
Replied on a separate thread. You are going to look at your schedule and I asked for some time before 1:00. If that for some reason does not work, I
could make time after. I don’t want anything to stop progress now that we have a plan!
Sent:12/26/2023 at 10:32 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/26/2023 at 10:39 AM)
Subject:Re: Regroup as Discussed
Message 56 of 4024
Can you do 11:15 today?
Sent:12/26/2023 at 10:40 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/26/2023 at 10:41 AM)
Subject:Re: Regroup as Discussed
Message 57 of 4024
Yes... did you see the other thread? I want to be sure if we communicate it’s civil and productive. I’m not trying to control you. I am only asking that
we start any communication without disagreeing or arguing about things that are in the past. Where we both have a lot of hurt. That is better left for
the therapy that Dr Brown recommended. Not amateurs like us.
Sent:12/26/2023 at 10:47 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/26/2023 at 10:51 AM)
Subject:Re: Regroup as Discussed
Message 58 of 4024
I’m on our Teams meeting
Sent:12/26/2023 at 11:16 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/26/2023 at 02:34 PM)
Subject:Re: Regroup as Discussed
Message 59 of 4024
AD needed an old Xbox 360 to play his game so I went to Auburn to get one in the cheap. And Max wants his PJs from Elsa that he left by accident.
Mind if I swing them by and pick up my package at your convenience?
Sent:12/26/2023 at 01:12 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/26/2023 at 02:34 PM)
Subject:Swap Today...

Message 60 of 4024
Hey- thanks for reading this earlier. Just let me know!
Sent:12/26/2023 at 02:52 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/26/2023 at 03:32 PM)
Subject:Re: Swap Today...
Message 61 of 4024
I’m fine with drop off. Just lmk timing.
Sent:12/26/2023 at 03:32 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/26/2023 at 03:32 PM)
Subject:Re: Swap Today...
Message 62 of 4024
Not sure exactly what you mean?
Can we swap? I’d like my stuff too.
I could be there by 4:00 if it works.
Sent:12/26/2023 at 03:34 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/26/2023 at 03:36 PM)
Subject:Re: Swap Today...
Message 63 of 4024
Ok but I’m not sure where your stuff is 4pm is fine
Sent:12/26/2023 at 03:37 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/26/2023 at 03:37 PM)
Subject:Re: Swap Today...
Message 64 of 4024
In mailbox? I’ll be a little after 4:00 since I’m just getting this. Thanks!
Sent:12/26/2023 at 03:39 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/26/2023 at 03:39 PM)

Message 65 of 4024
Ok!
Sent:12/26/2023 at 03:40 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/26/2023 at 03:41 PM)
Subject:Re: Swap Today...

Thank You!!!
That was SO much nicer!
Let’s kill it in 2024
Sent:12/26/2023 at 04:12 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/26/2023 at 04:14 PM)
Subject:Re: Swap Today...
